t: The Righteous and the Wicked Contrasted.
How*pn blessed is the man who does not walk in the counsel of the wicked, Nor*ln stand in the path of sinners, Nor*ln sit in the seat of scoffers!
But*ln his delight is in the law of the Lord,*s And*ln in His law he meditates day and night.
He*ln will be like a tree firmly*i planted by streams of water, Which*ln yields its fruit in its season And*ln its leaf does not wither; And*ln in whatever he does, he prospers.
The*ln wicked are not so, But*ln they are like chaff which the wind drives away.
Therefore*ln the wicked will not stand in the judgment, Nor*ln sinners in the assembly of the righteous.
For*ln the Lord*s knows the way of the righteous, But*ln the way of the wicked will perish.
